intro: Gonostemon longipedicellatus, commonly known as the long-pedicellate gonostemon, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. It is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed or open habitats.
